texts.definition: Gameplay where players acquire cards to their decks during gameplay in order for these to be used later in the same game instance.
markups: <style="Definition">Gameplay where players acquire cards to their decks during gameplay in order for these to be used later in the same game instance.</style>

Some games allow players to have their own decks of cards. Those that allow players to increase the size of their deck through gameplay actions have <style="CurrentLink">Deck Building</style> as a mechanic.

Note: This pattern follows the distinction made in [https://boardgamegeek.com/boardgamemechanic/2664/deck-pool-building BoardGameGeek] that Deck Building refers to constructions of decks during gameplay. See Pre-Customized Decks for constructions of decks before gameplay.

<style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/A%20Few%20Acres%20of%20Snow">A Few Acres of Snow</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Dominion">Dominion</link></style>, and <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Thunderstone">Thunderstone</link></style> are all games with <style="CurrentLink">Deck Building</style> as a core mechanic. So is <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Legendary:%20A%20Marvel%20Deck%20Building%20Game">Legendary: A Marvel Deck Building Game</link></style> but this show that <style="CurrentLink">Deck Building</style> games can be co-operative. <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/A%20Study%20in%20Emerald">A Study in Emerald</link></style> provides a team-based example even if players initially do not know which other players are on their team while <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Airborne%20Commander">Airborne Commander</link></style> shows that <style="CurrentLink">Deck Building</style> games can be solitaire games.

Magic: The Gathering and The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring Deck-Building Game have players build their decks before gameplay begins, so these games use the pattern Pre-Customized Decks rather than Deck Building. Mystic Vale provides an alternative to Deck Building in that players of this game build Cards through inserting transparent upgrades to sleeved cards.

Normally, <style="CurrentLink">Deck Building</style> is used in games to let players have agency on which <style="Link"><link="cards">Cards</link></style> should be in <style="Link"><link="decks">Decks</link></style>. Players typically use this to affect the <style="Link"><link="randomness">Randomness</link></style> of their potential <style="Link"><link="hands">Hands</link></style> by getting <style="Link"><link="cards">Cards</link></style> that increase their chances of <style="Link"><link="combos">Combos</link></style> and <style="Link"><link="gameplay-engines">Gameplay Engines</link></style>. One specific example possible through the combination of <style="Link"><link="cards">Cards</link></style> and <style="Link"><link="drawing-stacks">Drawing Stacks</link></style> are <style="Link"><link="cycle-deck-engines">Cycle Deck Engines</link></style>. Most games using <style="CurrentLink">Deck Building</style> have new <style="Link"><link="cards">Cards</link></style> put in <style="Link"><link="discard-piles">Discard Piles</link></style>, which create a form of <style="Link"><link="cooldown">Cooldown</link></style> for new <style="Link"><link="cards">Cards</link></style>.

The design choices related to <style="CurrentLink">Deck Building</style> mostly concern which actions should be available for getting new <style="Link"><link="cards">Cards</link></style>, what effects these <style="Link"><link="cards">Cards</link></style> have, and from where the <style="Link"><link="cards">Cards</link></style> can be gotten. Typically this also means determining price for <style="Link"><link="cards">Cards</link></style> to make more powerful <style="Link"><link="cards">Cards</link></style> more difficult to get into one's <style="Link"><link="decks">Deck</link></style>. These effect of new <style="Link"><link="cards">Cards</link></style> tend to be

either <style="Link"><link="improved-abilities">Improved</link></style> or <style="Link"><link="new-abilities">New Abilities</link></style>. <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Dominion">Dominion</link></style> lets players see all <style="Link"><link="cards">Cards</link></style> that are purchasable from the beginning while <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Legendary:%20A%20Marvel%20Deck%20Building%20Game">Legendary: A Marvel Deck Building Game</link></style> provides a limited number of <style="Link"><link="cards">Cards</link></style> at any time through the use of a <style="Link"><link="drafting-spreads">Drafting Spread</link></style>. While most design choices may relate to how new <style="Link"><link="cards">Cards</link></style> are provided there are also design possibilities concerning how <style="Link"><link="cards">Cards</link></style> can be modified or removed from <style="Link"><link="decks">Decks</link></style>. Modifying <style="Link"><link="cards">Cards</link></style> typically means making use of <style="Link"><link="card-building">Card Building</link></style> while providing means for players to remove <style="Link"><link="cards">Cards</link></style> (<style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Dominion">Dominion</link></style> does this through <style="Link"><link="cards">Cards</link></style> players need to acquire) leads to <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Deck%20Slimming">Deck Slimming</link></style>. Letting <style="Link"><link="decks">Decks</link></style> be modified between game instances create <style="Link"><link="meta-games">Meta Games</link></style> while performing permanent changes in the form of physically modifying or destroying cards create <style="Link"><link="legacy-games">Legacy Games</link></style>.

In many cases, <style="CurrentLink">Deck Building</style> games use <style="Link"><link="cards">Cards</link></style> to provide actions. This means that players typically need a starting deck which allows them to perform the actions of acquiring other cards through <style="CurrentLink">Deck Building</style>.

Players' <style="CurrentLink">Deck Building</style> is typically helped by <style="Link"><link="strategic-knowledge">Strategic Knowledge</link></style>, so the possibility of having this (about <style="Link"><link="cards">Cards</link></style> and their <style="Link"><link="combos">Combos</link></style>) in a game is likely to affect this pattern. <style="Link"><link="bag-building">Bag Building</link></style> can be an alternative to <style="CurrentLink">Deck Building</style> if not the design possibilities of <style="Link"><link="cards">Cards</link></style> (compared to <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Tokens">Tokens</link></style>) are need. <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Pre-Customized%20Decks">Pre-Customized Decks</link></style> is another alternative where players build their decks before gameplay begins.

<style="CurrentLink">Deck Building</style> modulates how <style="Link"><link="decks">Decks</link></style> are constructed by letting individual <style="Link"><link="cards">Cards</link></style> be added to them over time through <style="Link"><link="drafting">Drafting</link></style>. <style="Link"><link="game-element-insertion">Game Element Insertion</link></style> is a consequence of using <style="CurrentLink">Deck Building</style> since the <style="Link"><link="cards">Cards</link></style> introduce into <style="Link"><link="decks">Decks</link></style> by <style="CurrentLink">Deck Building</style> are typically not in play before this happens. However, this is not a strong case of <style="Link"><link="game-element-insertion">Game Element Insertion</link></style> as the <style="Link"><link="cards">Cards</link></style> typically already play a role as <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Limited%20Resources">Limited Resources</link></style> before being part of a <style="Link"><link="decks">Deck</link></style>.

Further, <style="CurrentLink">Deck Building</style> allows for <style="Link"><link="construction">Construction</link></style> and <style="Link"><link="abstract-player-construct-development">Abstract Player Construct Development</link></style>, and by doing so gives players a <style="Link"><link="freedom-choice">Freedom of Choice</link></style> of what should be in their <style="Link"><link="decks">Decks</link></style>. These new <style="Link"><link="cards">Cards</link></style> are <style="Link"><link="investments">Investments</link></style> and often associated with <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Risk/Reward">Risk/Reward</link></style> speculations since uncertainty exist both in <style="Link"><link="cards">Cards</link></style> will be gotten into players' <style="Link"><link="hands">Hands</link></style> at the right times and if other <style="Link"><link="cards">Cards</link></style> which work well together with the ones gotten will be available to get in the future. The patterns supports <style="Link"><link="varied-gameplay">Varied Gameplay</link></style> since players are unlikely to get the same <style="Link"><link="decks">Deck</link></style> in different game instances if there is a big enough variety of <style="Link"><link="cards">Cards</link></style>.

Building <style="Link"><link="decks">Decks</link></style> often result in players having <style="Link"><link="gain-competence">Gain Competence</link></style> goals and achieving these cause <style="Link"><link="stimulated-planning">Stimulated Planning</link></style> and <style="Link"><link="strategic-planning">Strategic Planning</link></style>. <style="CurrentLink">Deck Building</style> games often have <style="Link"><link="complex-gameplay">Complex Gameplay</link></style> since they make use of many different types of <style="Link"><link="cards">Cards</link></style> whose effects combine in different ways, and being able to handle this is a way to show <style="Link"><link="gameplay-mastery">Gameplay Mastery</link></style>.

<style="CurrentLink">Deck Building</style> does not support <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Closed%20Economies">Closed Economies</link></style> since it introduces new <style="Link"><link="cards">Cards</link></style> into <style="Link"><link="decks">Decks</link></style>. It can support <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Faucet/Drain">Faucet/Drain</link></style> system although removing <style="Link"><link="cards">Cards</link></style> tends to be less available as actions than introducing new ones.
